data.title: Deep Learning Models for Human Activity Recognition
data.description: Human activity recognition, or HAR, is a challenging time series classification task. It involves predicting the movement of a person based on sensor data and traditionally involves deep domain expertise and methods from signal processing to correctly engineer features from the raw data in order to fit a machine learning model. data.title: How to Develop a Framework to Spot-Check Machine Learning Algorithms in Python

data.title: Indoor Movement Time Series Classification with Machine Learning Algorithms
data.description: Indoor movement prediction involves using wireless sensor strength data to predict the location and motion of subjects within a building. It is a challenging problem as there is no direct analytical model to translate the variable length traces of signal strength data from multiple sensors into user behavior. data.title: Probabilistic Forecasting Model to Predict Air Pollution Days
data.description: Air pollution is characterized by the concentration of ground ozone. From meteorological measurements, such as wind speed and temperature, it is possible to forecast whether the ground ozone will be at a sufficiently high level tomorrow to issue a public air pollution warning. This is the basis behind a standard machine learning dataset used for […]

data.title: A Gentle Introduction to Probability Scoring Methods in Python
data.description: How to Score Probability Predictions in Python and Develop an Intuition for Different Metrics. Predicting probabilities instead of class labels for a classification problem can provide additional nuance and uncertainty for the predictions. The added nuance allows more sophisticated metrics to be used to interpret and evaluate the predicted probabilities. In general, methods for the […]

data.title: How to Get Started with Deep Learning for Time Series Forecasting (7-Day Mini-Course)
data.description: Deep Learning for Time Series Forecasting Crash Course. Bring Deep Learning methods to Your Time Series project in 7 Days. data.title: How and When to Use a Calibrated Classification Model with scikit-learn
data.description: Instead of predicting class values directly for a classification problem, it can be convenient to predict the probability of an observation belonging to each possible class. Predicting probabilities allows some flexibility including deciding how to interpret the probabilities, presenting predictions with uncertainty, and providing more nuanced ways to evaluate the skill of the model. Predicted […]

data.title: How to Use ROC Curves and Precision-Recall Curves for Classification in Python
data.description: It can be more flexible to predict probabilities of an observation belonging to each class in a classification problem rather than predicting classes directly. data.title: How to Predict Room Occupancy Based on Environmental Factors
data.description: Small computers, such as Arduino devices, can be used within buildings to record environmental variables from which simple and useful properties can be predicted. One example is predicting whether a room or rooms are occupied based on environmental measures such as temperature, humidity, and related measures. data.title: How to Model Volatility with ARCH and GARCH for Time Series Forecasting in Python
data.description: A change in the variance or volatility over time can cause problems when modeling time series with classical methods like ARIMA. The ARCH or Autoregressive Conditional Heteroskedasticity method provides a way to model a change in variance in a time series that is time dependent, such as increasing or decreasing volatility. An extension of this approach […]

data.title: 4 Common Machine Learning Data Transforms for Time Series Forecasting
data.description: Time series data often requires some preparation prior to being modeled with machine learning algorithms. For example, differencing operations can be used to remove trend and seasonal structure from the sequence in order to simplify the prediction problem. Some algorithms, such as neural networks, prefer data to be standardized and/or normalized prior to modeling. Any […]

data.title: A Gentle Introduction to Exponential Smoothing for Time Series Forecasting in Python
data.description: Exponential smoothing is a time series forecasting method for univariate data that can be extended to support data with a systematic trend or seasonal component. It is a powerful forecasting method that may be used as an alternative to the popular Box-Jenkins ARIMA family of methods. In this tutorial, you will discover the exponential smoothing […]

data.title: A Gentle Introduction to SARIMA for Time Series Forecasting in Python
data.description: Autoregressive Integrated Moving Average, or ARIMA, is one of the most widely used forecasting methods for univariate time series data forecasting. Although the method can handle data with a trend, it does not support time series with a seasonal component. An extension to ARIMA that supports the direct modeling of the seasonal component of the […]

data.title: 17 Statistical Hypothesis Tests in Python (Cheat Sheet)
data.description: Quick-reference guide to the 17 statistical hypothesis tests that you need in applied machine learning, with sample code in Python. data.title: How to Reduce Variance in a Final Machine Learning Model
data.description: A final machine learning model is one trained on all available data and is then used to make predictions on new data. A problem with most final models is that they suffer variance in their predictions. This means that each time you fit a model, you get a slightly different set of parameters that in […]

data.title: How to Develop a Skillful Machine Learning Time Series Forecasting Model
data.description: You are handed data and told to develop a forecast model. What do you do? This is a common situation; far more common than most people think. Perhaps you are sent a CSV file. data.title: Taxonomy of Time Series Forecasting Problems
data.description: When you are presented with a new time series forecasting problem, there are many things to consider.
